intro: Achyrocline tombadorensis, commonly known as the Tombador Islands shrub, is a flowering plant native to the Galápagos Islands. It is a small shrub characterized by its woody stems and narrow, lance-shaped leaves. The plant produces small, white to pale pink flowers that are clustered in dense inflorescences. It thrives in the arid and coastal environments of its native habitat. Due to its limited distribution and vulnerability to environmental changes, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
